code_examples.explanation: The User class violates SRP because it handles both data persistence and email communication, combining two unrelated responsibilities.
The Employee class violates SRP by handling both salary computation and payslip display logic, merging business and presentation responsibilities.
The Book class violates SRP by including both printing and file-saving responsibilities, mixing content representation and I/O operations.
The Product class mixes pricing logic with UI display methods, breaking SRP by combining computation and visualization responsibilities.
This User class violates SRP by combining database management, email communication, validation, authentication, and account logic within one class.
